U.S. never found substantial evidence of an active Iraqi program to produce weapons of mass destruction, but Rumsfeld believed that the site near the Iranian border presented the best chance to prove they existed before the war began. For whatever reason, the administration never made public these facts about an active WMD production facility run by terrorists in Iraq, Rumsfeld wrote.
